title: Greater Boston town issues guidance after bobcat sighting
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dedham Animal Control advised residents on safe practices after a bobcat was sighted near Deerpath Road and Route 109.
Bobcat sightings, though infrequent, occur because Dedham has a known bobcat population; the animals adapt to human environments.
Residents are urged to supervise pets outdoors, seal off crawl spaces, and report aggressive wildlife to animal control.

title: Alex Cora gives an early preview of Red Sox 2026 lineup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Cora reveals potential 2026 Red Sox Opening Day lineup with Roman Anthony and Trevor Story leading off.
Roman Anthony and Trevor Story projected to lead off Red Sox lineup; Anthony batted .336 as a leadoff in 2025.
Marcelo Mayer, despite being a top prospect, unlikely to start on Opening Day, potentially replaced by Isiah Kiner-Falefa.

title: Live updates: What to know about the nor’easter hitting Massachusetts
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Massachusetts is facing up to 2 feet of snow and high winds from a nor'easter, causing potential power outages.
Governor Maura Healey urges residents to stay off roads as Boston declares a snow emergency, closing schools and buildings.
Utility crews are positioned in high-risk areas, with warnings about power outages from fallen trees and live wires.

title: Bruins react to McAvoy, Swayman’s gold-medal win over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman won Olympic gold with Team USA in hockey, defeating Canada 2-1 in overtime.
McAvoy played a pivotal role defensively, with a key play in the third period securing USA's victory.
Bruins teammates and coaches celebrated the win, with hopes that it will boost McAvoy and Swayman in the NHL season.

title: 2026 NFL Mock Draft roundup: 7 names for Patriots fans to know entering combine week
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots hold the No. 31 pick in the 2026 NFL Draft, focusing mainly on trench players.
Draft experts suggest the Patriots might select either EDGE Zion Young or OT Max Iheanachor.
Tight end Kenyon Sadiq is linked to the team, despite it not being a primary need.

title: Team USA writes a new chapter and other takeaways from gold-medal triumph over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA men's hockey team wins its first Olympic gold medal since 1980, defeating Canada 2-1 in Milan.
Jack Hughes scored the decisive goal in 3-on-3 overtime, sealing the victory for the United States.
Goalie Connor Hellebuyck stopped 41 shots, delivering a standout performance against Canada’s strong offense.

title: 5 takeaways from the Revolution’s season-opening defeat in Nashville
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution lost 4-1 to Nashville SC in the 2026 MLS season opener under new coach Marko Mitrović.
The Revolution struggled defensively with three key defenders missing and conceded early goals due to defensive lapses.
Lineup decisions, including benching Ilay Feingold and Alhassan Yusuf, raised questions after the comprehensive loss.

title: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station break down again
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station have faced operational issues due to harsh winter conditions since their installation.
Gates have been shut down twice, with wind and snow causing disruptions since late January's major storm.
The fare gates, costing over $3.3 million, aimed to reduce fare evasion, but struggled against Boston’s winter elements.

title: Watch: Jack Hughes delivers USA first Olympic gold medal in men’s hockey since 1980, team honors Johnny Gaudreau
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jack Hughes scored the game-winning goal as Team USA defeated Canada 2-1 in overtime to win gold in men's hockey.
The victory marks Team USA's first Olympic gold medal in men's hockey since the 1980 Winter Olympics.
Team USA honored the late Johnny Gaudreau by involving his children in the celebrations during the gold medal ceremony.

title: After homering in spring training debut, could Andruw Monasterio play big role for Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Andruw Monasterio homered in the Red Sox' Grapefruit League opener, impressing manager Alex Cora with his athleticism and versatility.
Monasterio, acquired from the Brewers, could play a key role as a primary platoon infielder for Boston in the 2026 season.
Romy Gonzalez's injury opens competition for the infield role, with Monasterio having improved hitting stats against lefties in 2025.
